alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Montgomery; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:31PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pike, southwestern Bullock and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 731 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pine Level, or 9 miles east of Meadville, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Meadville, Banks, Pine Level, Kent, Dublin, Antioch, Beans Crossroads, Linwood, Shopton, Ansley, Troy Municipal Airport, Troy University, High Ridge, Orion, China Grove, Sandfield, Brundidge Municipal Airport and Currys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
